summary: This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank Private Bank regarding various entities associated with Southern Financial LLC and Southern Financial Group, highlighting multiple SEC violations related to insider trading and securities fraud. The alerts detail regulatory actions taken against these entities, including contempt of court rulings and fraudulent investment schemes.

persons.name: Tracy Calvin Dunlap, Jr.
persons.context: Dunlap was adjudged in contempt of court for refusing to produce documents and account for investor funds in relation to Southern Financial Group.

persons.name: James W. "Bill" Bailey, Jr.
persons.context: Bailey was charged with securities fraud and other offenses related to a Ponzi scheme involving Southern Financial Services.

persons.name: Richard M. Wooten
persons.context: Wooten is mentioned as a defendant in multiple SEC actions against Southern Financial Group.

persons.name: Charles Dennis McKittrick
persons.context: McKittrick is also named as a defendant in SEC actions against Southern Financial Group.

persons.name: Gerald F. Hunter, Jr.
persons.context: Hunter is mentioned as a defendant in SEC actions against Southern Financial Group.

connections.description: Dunlap is a defendant in actions against Southern Financial Group for contempt of court.
Bailey founded and operated Southern Financial Services Inc., which was involved in fraudulent activities.
Wooten is a defendant in multiple SEC actions against Southern Financial Group.
McKittrick is a defendant in multiple SEC actions against Southern Financial Group.
Hunter is a defendant in multiple SEC actions against Southern Financial Group.

events.title: SEC Civil Charges Filed
events.description: The SEC filed civil charges against the former president of Dicom Imaging Systems and five stock promoters, including Southern Financial Services, for securities fraud.

events.title: Court Adjudges Defendants in Contempt
events.description: The court found Southern Financial Group and Tracy Calvin Dunlap, Jr. in contempt for failing to produce documents and account for investor funds.

events.title: Court Affirms Incarceration Order
events.description: The Court of Appeals affirmed the trial court's order incarcerating Dunlap for contempt related to Southern Financial Group's fraudulent activities.

events.title: Final Judgments Entered
events.description: Final judgments were entered against Southern Financial Group, Richard M. Wooten, and Charles Dennis McKittrick for SEC violations.

events.title: Final Judgments for Fraudulent Investment Scam
events.description: Final judgments were entered against Southern Financial Group for a fraudulent high-yield investment scam.

keyFacts: Southern Financial Services, Inc. was involved in SEC violations related to insider trading and securities fraud.
Tracy Calvin Dunlap, Jr. was adjudged in contempt of court for failing to comply with court orders.
James W. "Bill" Bailey, Jr. was charged with securities fraud in connection with a Ponzi scheme.
Richard M. Wooten, Charles Dennis McKittrick, and Gerald F. Hunter, Jr. were named defendants in multiple SEC actions.
Southern Financial Group faced multiple regulatory actions for fraudulent investment schemes.
